description.narrative: By 2020, the child protection system, NGOs and families have increased capacity to detect, refer, assess, prevent and manage cases of children victims of gender-based violence and child marriage, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education and CP systems, NGOs and communities increasingly provide vulnerable girls and boys with gender-sensitive opportunities to realize their rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the child protection system, NGOs and families have increased capacity to detect, refer, assess, prevent and manage casesof children victims of gender-based violence and child marriage

description.narrative: UNICEF continued promoting gender equality for girls and boys through sustained partnership with the MoFLSS, civil society and the UN agencies participating in the “UN Joint Programme for the Prevention of Child, Early and Forced Marriage in Turkey”.UNICEF also continued to systematically strengthen the social service workforce’s capacity nationwide for more effective prevention of and response to gender-based violence. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
